Pre-Game Insights: Michele Marcolini, the Malta coach, admitted that promotion in the UEFA Nations League was the team's primary objective.
Marcolini said that the team's ultimate goal is to win games and secure promotion to League C.
Marcolini described the Moldova team as 'one of the strongest sides in League D' and said that the opening match against Moldova on away turf poses a major challenge for him and his team.
Marcolini mentioned that Moldova have a solid Euro 2024 qualifying campaign and secured a very impressive victory against Poland, which is testament to the strength of this team.

Marcolini said that Moldova will be very aggressive and the Malta team needs to keep an eye on their experienced players, particularly midfielder Artur Ionita who has gained a lot of experience during his playing spell in Italy.
Marcolini is without three experienced players for today's match as defensive duo Steve Borg and Enrico Pepe as well as midfielder Bjorn Kristensen were all ruled out of the game due to injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Malta national football team's ambition of winning promotion in the UEFA Nations League is facing a major test in Chisinau when they open their UEFA Nations League campaign against Moldova at the Stadionul Zimbru on Saturday evening.

The Malta team has failed to reach this objective in both editions held in 2020 and 2022, as on each occasion the team had to settle for second place in the group behind first the Faroe Islands and then Estonia.

Goalkeeper Henry Bonello said that the absence of his Ħamrun Spartans team-mate Steve Borg was a major miss, but the team still has a lot of quality to try and fill the void of those players who didn’t make it for this match.
